an5.108:4.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five factors is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, worthy of veneration with folded palms, and is a supreme field of merit for the world.
an5.108:5.2: It’s when they have the entire spectrum of the master’s ethics, samādhi, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom.
an5.108:5.3: A mendicant with these five qualities … is a supreme field of merit for the world.”
